You can become the master of your own Star Wars hero's journey. Love it, it is PERFECT! The packaging is excellent! Now, here are some things... this unit does not come with the riser to make it taller, you can buy the riser from the arcade 1up website. This unit was very easy and simple to put together - the instructions were very clear. Couple of things on that.... when it comes to the deck that the joystick sits on, there is a sticker that says to remove the film from BOTH sides - this means that clear plastic that goes on top of the deck. Yes there is film on both sides but it isnt obvious. If the cover is not completely crystal clear, then you left the film on one side. Also, the only difficulty I had was attaching the back cover, strangely enough. It was simple, but because of the screws it didnt want to go in. Use different (smaller) screws. And one last thing - when you first turn it on, it takes a minute before the screen goes on, so dont panic like I did lol.  This unit is NOT heavy so please do yourself a big favor and attach it to the wall with the provided hardware. I did not receive the Xbox game that was supposed to come with it.  The associate at the store told me it was still in transit which I found out was not the case.  The store manager was supposed to reach out to me about this but that never happened either.  On the bright side the online rep did do a good job of making things right.

BEST IN CLASS GAMEPLAY

Gift for my husband he loved it Nba 2k20 is the only basketball game based off the NBA for this season. The game has different modes for all basketball fans. It has play now for the NBA and WNBA for people that want to play a quick game with either your friend or against a computer. Its most popular mode is MyCareer which allows you to create a player and go through a storyline while playing in the NBA. You can get endorsements and also gain fans. Inside of MyCareer is The Neighborhood which you can shop for virtual items for your player or compete against other people online. Another mode is MyLeague which lets you be the GM of an NBA and try to get your team to win the championship. Lastly there is MyTeam which is a mode where you buy cards and make a team and compete against other people?s teams. Unless you are really into video games I do not recommend this game for you. It will only cause stress on you as the online servers are not good, the game does not reflect realistically on basketball, and to get good on the online modes you will have to spend money on top of the money you already spent on the game.

Ghost of Tsushima, Sony, PlayStation 4 Incredibly immersive, beautiful open world game game that is filled with authentic Japanese culture. It is surprisingly relaxing to play. I enjoyed playing it in Japanese spoken language with English subtitles, something that is optional. It has a camera mode that you can quickly get in/out. I found myself snapping pictures (something I don't ever do) at SO many points because it is just beautiful lol. I recommend playing with a PS4 PRO to get the most out of this game. If you have a 4K HDR tv then you will be BLOWN away by the graphics. Im not a big open world games BUT this game isn't filled with your typical fetch quests mission but filled with compelling content, with progressive skill trees, customizable gear and lots of collectables if you choose. Ive also seen a lot of reviews that state how difficult the game was so I went into it thinking it was going to be hard ...and its not really. I wish I started on the hardest difficulty, but I played it on normal. It's not a button masher at all. It has different fighting stances that you change up on the fly during battles and plenty of stealth mission. The fight style it closely resembles is Assassins Creed. If I were to criticize it in one way, it needs improvement with the camera system and should snap behind your player. Once you get the hang of how to fight and use the camera, it gets easy. This game it's bad. During all the game the enemies are soooo EASY, that's some times it's boring. But i still playing hopping they would get harder. But then I faced Ryuzo, that was a Game Over. I lost against Ryuzo over 50 times and I gave up! Ryuzo killed me with 3 hits ONLY! even when my suit was upgraded to the top, and Ryuzo dodged almost 90% of all my hits and every hit was reducing almost nothing when my sword was upgraded to the end. I tried to dodge their attack and he updated their hit to match my dodge movement every time . Ryuzo = Game Over, good look

The Last of Us Part II, Sony, PlayStation 4, 711719519102

Five years after their dangerous journey across the post-pandemic United States, Ellie and Joel have settled down in Jackson, Wyoming.

Don't let people say "it's forcing politics down your throat" make you believe it. Anyone who played the DLC content for how Ellie became bitten in the first place was not surprised at the beginning of the game. And to get all been out of shape because of a belief or decision that another person makes any game is stupid because those same beliefs and choices are made in the real world, and this game series has focused on realistic emotions and feelings that the characters go through. That there's two sides to every conflict, and that maybe the people whom we think are evil is a victim themselves and is also after a form of justice. I managed to go into this game completely spoiler-free, and can say honestly, it is one of the best games I've ever played. I may not agree with certain decisions and choices in the game, but it's not about me, it's about what the characters are deciding to do and for us to see it through. The game truly is a masterpiece and tells next story of human emotion and survival in the worst of situations. We all waited a long tie for this game to come out. The Last of Us was an awesome game one of our favorites. We were extremely excited to get it when it came. What a disappointment. killing off Joel was a huge mistake and then having to play as Abby when you just wanted her dead. Ruined for me!!

Need for Speed Heat, Electronic Arts, PlayStation 4

Hustle by day and risk it all at night in need for speed heat, a white knuckles racer that pits you against a city's rogue Police force as you battle your way into Street Racing's Elite. By day compete in the speed Hunter Showdown a sanctioned competition where you earn Bank to customize and upgrade your garage of high performance cars. When your ride's perfectly styled and hyper tuned, and you're ready to ramp up the intensity, drive out into the night where you and your crew take on the competition in illicit Street races that build your reputation and grant you access to bigger races and better parts. But under the cover of darkness patrols a rogue task force looking to bring you down and swipe all you've earned. Take them on and risk it all for underground glory or head back to your safe house and begin another thrilling day. The roads, the risks, and the rides never end in this Street racer where your crew rolls deep, your garage is full of hot cars, and the city's your nonstop playground.

Oculus Quest 2 — Advanced All-In-One Virtual Reality Headset — 64 GB Oculus Quest 2 is our most advanced all-in-one VR system yet. Every detail has been engineered to make virtual worlds adapt to your movements, letting you explore awe-inspiring games and experiences with unparalleled freedom. No PC or console required. Get the most out of each moment with blazing-fast performance and next-generation graphics. Stay focused with a stunning display that features 50% more pixels than the original Quest. Or take a break from the action and grab front-row seats to live concerts, exclusive events and more. The redesigned Touch controllers feature improved ergonomics and intuitive controls that transport your gestures, motions and actions directly into VR. You can even connect your VR headset to a gaming-compatible computer with an Oculus Link cable to access hundreds of PC VR games and experiences. Quest 2 also lets you bring your friends into the action. With live casting, you can share your VR experience with people around you. Or meet up with friends in virtual worlds to battle in multiplayer competitions or just spend some time together. With Oculus Quest 2, there’sno end in sight to what you can play, create and discover in virtual reality i cant stop thinking about this, i have been playing on psvr but i cant wait to not having to deal with cables and only being able to face in one direction for games like superhot and arizona sunshine. i just want it so bad, i dont feel like i can wait 2 days So the fact it comes with cable to connect to a gaming pc is sketchy and suggests that it still underperforms compared to the rift and rift s.  The last quest was a cartoon version of VR this sounds like another half cocked version of what wireless VR should be. To make a good wireless VR set its going to cost double. No way around it. Oculus is going the cheap route so they can attempt to alleviate the recent loss in active facebook accounts.

Lose yourself in the experience with a comfortable, improved design that lets you start playing faster and keep playing longer. Oculus Insight tracking gives you the power to move throughout your playspace in any direction. No external sensors. No complicated setup. Just hands-on action and interaction with our updated Oculus Touch controllers right out of the box. Step into the game and the future of PC VR. The Oculus Rift S is a great problem. But I did see you can buy extras, which is a great idea for extra gifts to keep the toy fresh for the kids. Thank you Step2 for letting my son test out this toy as part of the Step2 Toy Tester Program! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My 3 year old boy and 4 year old girl  was very excited for for a workbench but their excitement quickly faded when the set up took me a bit longer than expected. Here's a setup tip: use a drill, not a screwdriver as shown in the instruction images. After the work bench was constructed I noticed I was missing a few of the toy nuts and bolts and some of the smaller peices. Also, the little orange bucket on the side of the surface kept falling off. 

After hammering and sawing away for about half an hour, they quickly grew bored of the workbench itself and began to “construct” using the toy tools around the house. After a while the noise level in the house really got to me.  After a while they kept asking me to “fix the drill” which seemed defective and stopped working later that very first day. that being said a couple of days later they did return to playing with the workbench but had begun pretending it was a kitchen set. 
 
Summary: the tools are the only things the kids really play with beyond the first couple days. so if your kids have limited play space this workbench is less than ideal. This product would be a lot better if it included something for the kids to use the tools on to “construct” and simulate a building experience. The current “wooden” car is more of a puzzle than anything else and we were not able to fit it together

Note:this product was received free of change in exchange for a product review. The opinions and views represented in this review speak only to my personal experience with the product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Step2 Wild Whirlpool Water Table With 11 Piece Accessory Set With the Step2 Wild Whirlpool Water Table, it's time for your little ones to enter the splash zone and channel their inner explorer. This toy features a tower that creates a water vortex as water is poured through, by using either the provided boat or scoop to create the water tornado to power the water spinner. The scoop can be used to capture the six sea creatures (four fish and two turtles) that are included with this kids' water table. It also includes a rotating octopus that creates a whirlpool effect for some extra adventures. This Step2 Wild Whirlpool Water Table provides hours of wet and slippery fun outdoors.
